article.title: Change History
article.p: In this section we highlight headline changes between the major releases. For full details of changes between maintenance releases, see the Saxon/C Release Notes, and for details of bug fixes see the Saxon/C project at the Saxonica community site.

ul.li: Updated the core XSLT processor to the Java Saxon 9.9.1.5 version.
Updated APIs: Support for XSLT 3.0, XQuery 3.1, XPath 3.1 and Schema Validation 1.0/1.1.

Added a feature rich XSLT 3.0 processor API to the languages: C++, PHP 7.2 and Python. Therefore two XSLT Processor classes are now available for each language supported:
C++ APIs: XsltProcessor and Xslt30Processor
Python APIs: PyXsltProcessor and PyXslt30Processor
PHP APIs: Saxon\XsltProcessor and Saxon\Xslt30Processor
Added Python3 API to the suite of programming languages supported by Saxon/C. The Python extension was implemented using Cython.
Updated to Excelsior JET Enterprise 15.3 (MP1) cross compiler tool.
Additional methods in the APIs for XSLT and XQuery in C++ and PHP. (Also supported in the new Python API.)
XML Catalog file support in Saxon/C.

Saxon/C (all editions) can load stylesheets generated in the form of SEF files either by Saxon/C itself, or by Saxon-EE/J 9.9. Saxon-EE/C can also generate SEF files for use by Saxon/J, Saxon/C, or Saxon-JS 1.2.

The following bugs have been fixed:
Bug #2055: Apache allocates a lot of memory without releasing it
Bug #3837: Cannot locate the built PHP extension in Saxon/HE for Mac OS X
Bug #4274: Using a catalog file with Saxon in PHP
Bug #4302: High memory usage with Saxon/C + PHP
Updated the core XSLT processor to the Java Saxon 9.8.0.4 version.
Updated APIs: Support for XSLT 3.0, XQuery 3.1, XPath 2.0/3.0 and Schema Validation 1.0/1.1.
Added XDM Data Model API in support of the specs XPath, XQuery, XSLT and Schema Validation.
Support for user defined functions. Users can now write their functions in C++/PHP and invoke them in XSLT, XQuery and XPath.
Updated to Excelsior JET 11.3 (MP1) cross compiler tool
Revised API for XSLT and XQuery in C, C++ and PHP
